original: Blide, Carl Gösta, byggnadschef, Halmstad, f. 28/1/06 i Vättersnäs, Jönköp. I., av inspektör Carl B. o. Emilia Malmberg. G. 31 m. Ruth Storm. Barn: Inger f. 33, Göran 37. — Stud:ex. v. Vasa lärov. i Gbg 25, avg:ex. fr. CTH (VoV) 30. Bitr. ing. v. gatukont. i Gbg 30, ing. v. vattenfallsstyr. 30-36, bitr. stadsing. i Söderhamn 36-38, gatuing. o. tf. byggn:-chef i Örebro 38-44, byggnadschef i Trollhättan 44-47, i Ha-lmistad fr. 47. Medl. av Frimurarorden, Rotarykl.
translated: Blide, Carl Gösta, construction manager, Halmstad, b. January 28, 1906 in Vättersnäs, Jönköping County, son of inspector Carl B. and Emilia Malmberg. Married in 1931 to Ruth Storm, with whom he had two children: Inger, born in 1933, and Göran, born in 1937. He attended Vasa läroverk in Gothenburg, graduating in 1925, and graduated from Chalmers University of Technology in 1930. He worked as a assistant engineer at the road administration in Gothenburg from 1930, as an engineer at the power company Vattenfall from 1930 to 1936, as an assistant city engineer in Söderhamn from 1936 to 1938, and then as a street engineer and acting building chief in Örebro from 1938 to 1944. From 1944 to 1947 he was the building manager in Trollhättan, and from 1947 in Halmstad. He was a member of the Freemasons and Rotary Club.

employmentHistory.name: Örebro
employmentHistory.jobTitle: Street Engineer and Acting Building Chief
